thread.title: UK government defeated as Lords back powers to block or change EU exit deal

title: UK government defeated as Lords back powers to block or change EU exit deal
text:
April 30, 2018 / 4:04 PM / Updated 35 minutes ago UK government defeated as Lords back powers to block or change EU exit deal Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain’s House of Lords voted on Monday to give parliament powers to block or delay the final deal on the country’s departure from the European Union, defeating Prime Minister Theresa May’s government. Sarah Clarke is introduced as the new Black Rod to the House of Lords in London, Britain February 20, 2018. REUTERS/Victoria Jones/Pool
Lords, who sit in parliament’s upper chamber, voted 335 to 244 in favour of an amendment that could allow parliament to send Britain back to the negotiating table in Brussels or even halt the Brexit process.
The amendment is opposed by the government and can be overturned in parliament’s lower chamber, where May has a slim majority. Reporting by William James, editing by Elizabeth Piper
